_header: Solomon the wise he taught in his life
_description: An anti-marital carol — 6 five-line stanzas (aaaab) and burden: ‘All fresche, all fresch, fresch is my song’

OxfLinLat141.First Lines:
Salomon þe wyse he tawt in hys lyfTo all maner men þat
                    cast hem for to wyffe…
OxfLinLat141.Last Lines:
…Or þat þou wed hyre lok þat sche be goodOr
                    ellys sche will put a bone all in þi hoodSalomon to
                    wyttnes
OxfLinLat141.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             “Two Unpublished Fifteenth-Century Poems from Lincoln College, Oxford,
                MS. Lat. 141.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 27 [225] (1980): 20-6: 25.
